question: Pandit Jawahar Lal Nehru described which of the following multi-purpose project as temple of a resurgent India?
explanation: According to Jawaharlal Nehru, power and steel are the key bases for planning. He described the 680 ft Bhakra multi-purpose project on the Sutlej river in Himachal Pradesh as the new temple of a resurgent India. The Indian Institutes of Technology and the Atomic Energy Commission were the other “modern temples".
